intro: Ochlopoa infirma, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often showy, but non-showy, floral structures. The plant typically grows in dry, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Ochlopoa infirma is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
